{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year = 1994 |Team = Alabama Crimson Tide |Image= |ImageSize = |Conference = Southeastern Conference |Division = Western Division |ShortConference = SEC |CoachRank = 4 |APRank = 5 |Record = 12â1 |ConfRecord = 8â0 |HeadCoach = [[Gene Stallings]] |HCYear = 5th |Captain=Jay Barker |Captain2=Tarrant Lynch |Captain3=Tommy Johnson |Captain4=Sam Shade |OffCoach = |OScheme = |DefCoach = |DScheme = |StadiumArena = [[Bryant-Denny Stadium]]
[[Legion Field]] |Champion=SEC Western Division Champions |BowlTourney = [[1995 Florida Citrus Bowl|Florida Citrus Bowl]] |BowlTourneyResult = W 24â17 vs. [[1994 Ohio State Buckeyes football team|Ohio State]] |ConfChamp= [[1994 SEC Championship Game|SEC Championship Game]] |ConfChampResult= L 24â23 vs. [[1994 Florida Gators football team|Florida]] }} {{1994 SEC football standings}} The '''1994 Alabama Crimson Tide football team''' was one of a long line of [[Alabama Crimson Tide football]] teams; it represented the [[University of Alabama]] for the [[1994 NCAA Division I-A football season|1994â95 college football season]], competing in the Western Division in the [[Southeastern Conference]]. [[Gene Stallings]] led the Crimson Tide to a perfect 11â0 regular season, only to see the Crimson Tide lose to the [[1994 Florida Gators football team|Florida Gators]] by one point in the [[SEC Championship Game]]. Highlights include a win over then unbeaten Auburn, and a dramatic victory over Georgia which is rebroadcast occasionally as part of the ESPN "Classic" series. Alabama beat [[1994 Ohio State Buckeyes football team|Ohio State]] in the {{Alternative links|1995 Florida Citrus Bowl|Florida Citrus Bowl|title=1995 Florida Citrus Bowl}} to finish their 1994 season with a 12â1 record. The team played their home games at [[Bryant-Denny Stadium]] in [[Tuscaloosa, Alabama]], and [[Legion Field]] in [[Birmingham, Alabama]]. ==Schedule== {{CFB Schedule Start| rank=yes |rankyear=1994 | tv=yes| time=no| attend=yes}} {{CFB Schedule Entry | rank = 11 | tv = | w/l = w | date = September 3 | nonconf = yes | time = no | opponent = {{cfb link|year=1994|team=Chattanooga Mocs|title=Tennessee-Chattanooga}} | site_stadium = [[Legion Field]] | site_cityst = [[Birmingham, Alabama]] | score = 42â13 | attend = 82,109 }} {{CFB Schedule Entry | rank = 11 | tv = [[Jefferson Pilot Sports|JP Sports]] | w/l = w | date = September 10 | nonconf = no | time = no | opponent = {{cfb link|year=1994|team=Vanderbilt Commodores|title=Vanderbilt}} | site_stadium = [[Bryant-Denny Stadium]] | site_cityst = [[Tuscaloosa, Alabama]] | score = 17â7 | attend = 70,123 }} {{CFB Schedule Entry | rank = 12 | tv = [[ABC Sports|ABC]] | w/l = w | date = September 17 | nonconf = no | time = no | away = yes | opponent = [[1994 Arkansas Razorbacks football team|Arkansas]] | site_stadium = [[Donald W.
